definition: Yellow Crane Tower in Wuhan City, built in 223, burnt down in 1884, rebuilt in 1985/favored place of poet sages, who in legend arrived riding golden cranes/Tang poem by Cui Hao 崔顥|崔颢[Cui1 Hao4], with theme 'the past will never return'/one of three famous pagodas in China along with Yueyang Tower 岳陽樓|岳阳楼[Yue4 yang2 Lou2] in Yueyang, north Hunan, and Tengwang Tower 滕王閣|滕王阁[Teng2 wang2 Ge2] in Nanchang, Jiangxi
surname Huang or Hwang
yellow/pornographic/to fall through
crane
surname Lou
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: People in Wuhan are proud of the Yellow Crane Tower.
Do you want to visit Yellow Crane tower.
You want the Yellow Crane Tower in the picture?
sentences.chinese: 你想将黄鹤楼照进相片吗？

sentences.english: I have to take the Yellow Crane to spare here, Yellow Crane Tower.
sentences.chinese: 昔人已乘黄鹤去，此地空余黄鹤楼。

sentences.english: Xiren Crane has adopted various measures in this part of the Yellow Crane Tower.
sentences.chinese: 锡仁起重机已采取各项措施，在这部分的黄鹤楼。

sentences.english: The visiting guests were escorted to the Yellow Crane Tower last Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 上周日，来访客和陪同人员一起参观了黄鹤楼。

sentences.english: At age 12, he stood here in Zhaolin Park and marveled at an ice replica of the Yellow Crane Tower, an ancient pagoda.
sentences.chinese: 12岁时，他曾对兆麟公园的冰雕黄鹤楼啧啧称奇。

sentences.english: " It is a real miracle that "Yellow Crane Tower" made the unparalleled poet Li Bai crown it as the best.
sentences.chinese: 一首《黄鹤楼》竟让绝代诗仙称首，实在是一个奇迹。

sentences.english: Huanghe Lou or Yellow Crane Tower is in Wuhan by Yangtze ZRiver, Hubei province.
sentences.chinese: 黄鹤楼故址在湖北省武汉市蛇山黄鹤湾，临长江。

sentences.english: Saw a "Spring" word clock and the restoration of the Yellow Crane Tower.
sentences.chinese: 看到了一个“春”字的钟和重修的黄鹤楼。

sentences.english: Wuhan is famous for the Yellow Crane Tower.
Do you know any most famous poem about yellow crane tower?
sentences.chinese: 你知道关于黄鹤楼的最著名的诗吗？

sentences.english: "The old friend west dismisses Yellow Crane Tower , fireworks goes to Yangzhou in March". Come from that poem?
sentences.chinese: “故人西辞黄鹤楼，烟花三月下扬州。”出自那首诗？

sentences.english: Lily: Do you want to visit Yellow Crane tower.
Zhang said it was the timing that saw Yellow Crane Tower out of contention for the Final Draw this year.
sentences.chinese: 张说这也是时候说明黄鹤楼不在举行盛典的讨论中了。

sentences.english: Every year millions of tourists visit the tower coming from different parts of China.
sentences.chinese: 每年都有几百万来自于全国各地的游客参观黄鹤楼。

definition: Yueyang Tower, famous beauty spot in Yueyang, north Hunan, overlooking Dongting Lake 洞庭湖[Dong4 ting2 Hu2]/one of three famous pagodas in China along with Yellow Crane Tower 黃鶴樓|黄鹤楼[Huang2 he4 Lou2] in Wuhan, Hubei and Tengwang Tower 滕王閣|滕王阁[Teng2 wang2 Ge2] in Nanchang, Jiangxi
Cui Hao (-754), Tang dynasty poet and author of poem Yellow Crane Tower 黃鶴樓|黄鹤楼

Tengwang Tower in Nanchang, Jiangxi/one of three famous pagodas in China along with Yueyang Tower 岳陽樓|岳阳楼[Yue4 yang2 Lou2] in Yueyang, north Hunan, and Yellow Crane Tower 黃鶴樓|黄鹤楼[Huang2 he4 Lou2] in Wuhan, Hubei
Aiwan Pavilion, on Mt Yuelu 岳麓山 in Hubei, famous beauty spot
Donghu district of Nanchang city 南昌市, Jiangxi
Mt Yuelu in Changsha 長沙|长沙[Chang2 sha1], famous for scenery, temples and tombs
Three Gorges or Yangtze Gorges, namely: Qutang Gorge 瞿塘峽|瞿塘峡[Qu2 tang2 Xia2], Wuxia Gorge 巫峽|巫峡[Wu1 Xia2] and Xiling Gorge 西陵峽|西陵峡[Xi1 ling2 Xia2]

Three Gorges on the Chang Jiang or Yangtze, namely: Qutang Gorge 瞿塘峽|瞿塘峡[Qu2 tang2 Xia2], Wuxia Gorge 巫峽|巫峡[Wu1 Xia2] and Xiling Gorge 西陵峽|西陵峡[Xi1 ling2 Xia2]/Sanxia or Sanhsia town in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
Yuelu Academy in Changsha, Hunan, famous ancient academy
memorial hall to Zhuge Liang 諸葛亮|诸葛亮 (many of them in different town)/refers to tourist attraction in Chengdu 成都
Giant Wild Goose Pagoda in Xi'an
Wuxia Gorge on the Changjiang or Yangtze, the middle of the Three Gorges 三峽|三峡[San1 Xia2]
Yangtze River, or Chang Jiang
Qu Yuan memorial temple on the Miluo river 汨羅江|汨罗江 at Yueyang 岳陽市|岳阳市, Hunan
Changjiang River/Yangtze River
Hanyang county in Hubei province/historical name Hanyang for Seoul, Korea
